channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Scalable Diffusion Models with State Space Backbone
item.description: We endeavor to train diffusion models for image data, wherein the traditional U-Net backbone is supplanted by a state space backbone, functioning on raw patches or latent space.

item.title: Learning to Route Among Specialized Experts for Zero-Shot Generalization
item.description: Unlike past methods that learn to route among specialized models, PHATGOOSE explores the possibility that zero-shot generalization will be improved if different experts can be adaptively chosen for each token and at each layer in the model.

item.title: REMEDI: Corrective Transformations for Improved Neural Entropy Estimation
item.description: The approach combines the minimization of the cross-entropy for simple, adaptive base models and the estimation of their deviation, in terms of the relative entropy, from the data density.

item.title: Accurate LoRA-Finetuning Quantization of LLMs via Information Retention
item.description: This paper proposes a novel IR-QLoRA for pushing quantized LLMs with LoRA to be highly accurate through information retention.

item.title: Classifying Nodes in Graphs without GNNs
item.description: Recently, distillation methods succeeded in eliminating the use of GNNs at test time but they still require them during training.

item.title: Spiking Neural Network Enhanced Hand Gesture Recognition Using Low-Cost Single-photon Avalanche Diode Array
item.description: We present a compact spiking convolutional neural network (SCNN) and spiking multilayer perceptron (SMLP) to recognize ten different gestures in dark and bright light environments, using a $9. 6 single-photon avalanche diode (SPAD) array.

item.title: Multi-Timescale Ensemble Q-learning for Markov Decision Process Policy Optimization
item.description: Reinforcement learning (RL) is a classical tool to solve network control or policy optimization problems in unknown environments.

item.title: Noise Contrastive Alignment of Language Models with Explicit Rewards
item.description: Existing alignment methods, such as Direct Preference Optimization (DPO), are mainly tailored for pairwise preference data where rewards are implicitly defined rather than explicitly given.

item.title: You Only Need One Color Space: An Efficient Network for Low-light Image Enhancement
item.description: Further, we design a novel Color and Intensity Decoupling Network (CIDNet) with two branches dedicated to processing the decoupled image brightness and color in the HVI space.

item.title: Zero-Shot Chain-of-Thought Reasoning Guided by Evolutionary Algorithms in Large Language Models
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) have demonstrated remarkable performance across diverse tasks and exhibited impressive reasoning abilities by applying zero-shot Chain-of-Thought (CoT) prompting.

item.title: SPHINX-X: Scaling Data and Parameters for a Family of Multi-modal Large Language Models
item.description: We propose SPHINX-X, an extensive Multimodality Large Language Model (MLLM) series developed upon SPHINX.

item.title: SoftEDA: Rethinking Rule-Based Data Augmentation with Soft Labels
item.description: Rule-based text data augmentation is widely used for NLP tasks due to its simplicity.

item.title: Rapid Optimization for Jailbreaking LLMs via Subconscious Exploitation and Echopraxia
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) have become prevalent across diverse sectors, transforming human life with their extraordinary reasoning and comprehension abilities.

item.title: Optimizing for ROC Curves on Class-Imbalanced Data by Training over a Family of Loss Functions
item.description: Although binary classification is a well-studied problem in computer vision, training reliable classifiers under severe class imbalance remains a challenging problem.

item.title: Everybody Prune Now: Structured Pruning of LLMs with only Forward Passes
item.description: Given the generational gap in available hardware between lay practitioners and the most endowed institutions, LLMs are becoming increasingly inaccessible as they grow in size.

item.title: MIGC: Multi-Instance Generation Controller for Text-to-Image Synthesis
item.description: Lastly, we aggregate all the shaded instances to provide the necessary information for accurately generating multiple instances in stable diffusion (SD).

item.title: An Ordinal Regression Framework for a Deep Learning Based Severity Assessment for Chest Radiographs
item.description: This study investigates the application of ordinal regression methods for categorizing disease severity in chest radiographs.

item.title: PromptCrypt: Prompt Encryption for Secure Communication with Large Language Models
item.description: While these models offer substantial benefits in terms of accessibility and functionality, they also introduce significant privacy concerns: the transmission and storage of user data in cloud infrastructures pose substantial risks of data breaches and unauthorized access to sensitive information; even if the transmission and storage of data is encrypted, the LLM service provider itself still knows the real contents of the data, preventing individuals or entities from confidently using such LLM services.

item.title: Risk-Sensitive Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning in Network Aggregative Markov Games
item.description: Under a set of assumptions, we prove the convergence of the algorithm to a subjective notion of Markov perfect Nash equilibrium in NAMGs.

item.title: Get What You Want, Not What You Don't: Image Content Suppression for Text-to-Image Diffusion Models
item.description: However, these models struggle to effectively suppress the generation of undesired content, which is explicitly requested to be omitted from the generated image in the prompt.

item.title: MTSA-SNN: A Multi-modal Time Series Analysis Model Based on Spiking Neural Network
item.description: To address these challenges, we propose a Multi-modal Time Series Analysis Model Based on Spiking Neural Network (MTSA-SNN).

item.title: DiffSpeaker: Speech-Driven 3D Facial Animation with Diffusion Transformer
item.description: We suspect this is due to a shortage of paired audio-4D data, which is crucial for the Transformer to effectively perform as a denoiser within the Diffusion framework.

item.title: Examining Gender and Racial Bias in Large Vision-Language Models Using a Novel Dataset of Parallel Images
item.description: Following on recent advances in large language models (LLMs) and subsequent chat models, a new wave of large vision-language models (LVLMs) has emerged.

item.title: Adaptive Activation Functions for Predictive Modeling with Sparse Experimental Data
item.description: A pivotal aspect in the design of neural networks lies in selecting activation functions, crucial for introducing nonlinear structures that capture intricate input-output patterns.

item.title: Permute-and-Flip: An optimally robust and watermarkable decoder for LLMs
item.description: In this paper, we propose a new decoding method called Permute-and-Flip (PF) decoder.

item.title: Training Large Language Models for Reasoning through Reverse Curriculum Reinforcement Learning
item.description: In this paper, we propose R$^3$: Learning Reasoning through Reverse Curriculum Reinforcement Learning (RL), a novel method that employs only outcome supervision to achieve the benefits of process supervision for large language models.

item.title: Discovering Temporally-Aware Reinforcement Learning Algorithms
item.description: We propose a simple augmentation to two existing objective discovery approaches that allows the discovered algorithm to dynamically update its objective function throughout the agent's training procedure, resulting in expressive schedules and increased generalization across different training horizons.

item.title: Dirichlet Flow Matching with Applications to DNA Sequence Design
item.description: Further, we provide distilled Dirichlet flow matching, which enables one-step sequence generation with minimal performance hits, resulting in $O(L)$ speedups compared to autoregressive models.

item.title: Prompting Fairness: Artificial Intelligence as Game Players
item.description: Utilitarian games such as dictator games to measure fairness have been studied in the social sciences for decades.

item.title: UAV-Rain1k: A Benchmark for Raindrop Removal from UAV Aerial Imagery
item.description: Raindrops adhering to the lens of UAVs can obstruct visibility of the background scene and degrade image quality.

item.title: Hidden in Plain Sight: Undetectable Adversarial Bias Attacks on Vulnerable Patient Populations
item.description: The proliferation of artificial intelligence (AI) in radiology has shed light on the risk of deep learning (DL) models exacerbating clinical biases towards vulnerable patient populations.

item.title: Multilingual E5 Text Embeddings: A Technical Report
item.description: This technical report presents the training methodology and evaluation results of the open-source multilingual E5 text embedding models, released in mid-2023.

item.title: AutoAugment Is What You Need: Enhancing Rule-based Augmentation Methods in Low-resource Regimes
item.description: Text data augmentation is a complex problem due to the discrete nature of sentences.

item.title: A High Dimensional Model for Adversarial Training: Geometry and Trade-Offs
item.description: This work investigates adversarial training in the context of margin-based linear classifiers in the high-dimensional regime where the dimension $d$ and the number of data points $n$ diverge with a fixed ratio $\alpha = n / d$.

item.title: Neural Multigrid Architectures
item.description: We argue that a fixed neural network without dense layers can not realize an efficient iterative method.

item.title: Rethinking Propagation for Unsupervised Graph Domain Adaptation
item.description: Motivated by our empirical analysis, we reevaluate the role of GNNs in graph domain adaptation and uncover the pivotal role of the propagation process in GNNs for adapting to different graph domains.

item.title: Knowledge Graphs Meet Multi-Modal Learning: A Comprehensive Survey
item.description: In this survey, we carefully review over 300 articles, focusing on KG-aware research in two principal aspects: KG-driven Multi-Modal (KG4MM) learning, where KGs support multi-modal tasks, and Multi-Modal Knowledge Graph (MM4KG), which extends KG studies into the MMKG realm.

item.title: Investigating White-Box Attacks for On-Device Models
item.description: Our findings emphasize the need for developers to carefully consider their model deployment strategies, and use white-box methods to evaluate the vulnerability of on-device models.

item.title: Privacy-Preserving Synthetic Continual Semantic Segmentation for Robotic Surgery
item.description: The problem becomes worse when it limits releasing the dataset of the old instruments for the old model due to privacy concerns and the unavailability of the data for the new or updated version of the instruments for the continual learning model.

item.title: Sandwiched Compression: Repurposing Standard Codecs with Neural Network Wrappers
item.description: Through a variety of examples, we apply the sandwich architecture to sources with different numbers of channels, higher resolution, higher dynamic range, and perceptual distortion measures.

item.title: GPTs Are Multilingual Annotators for Sequence Generation Tasks
item.description: However, the conventional approach of data annotation through crowdsourcing is both time-consuming and expensive.

item.title: Progressive Gradient Flow for Robust N:M Sparsity Training in Transformers
item.description: In this work, we study the effectiveness of existing sparse training recipes at \textit{high-sparsity regions} and argue that these methods fail to sustain the model quality on par with low-sparsity regions.

item.title: Physics Informed and Data Driven Simulation of Underwater Images via Residual Learning
item.description: We propose a deep learning-based architecture to automatically simulate the underwater effects where only a dehazing-like image formation equation is known to the network, and the additional degradation due to the other unknown factors if inferred in a data-driven way.

item.title: Moco: A Learnable Meta Optimizer for Combinatorial Optimization
item.description: Our approach, Moco, learns a graph neural network that updates the solution construction procedure based on features extracted from the current search state.

item.title: The Effect of Sampling Temperature on Problem Solving in Large Language Models
item.description: In this research study, we empirically investigate the effect of sampling temperature on the performance of Large Language Models (LLMs) on various problem-solving tasks.

item.title: Triplet Interaction Improves Graph Transformers: Accurate Molecular Graph Learning with Triplet Graph Transformers
item.description: We also obtain SOTA results on QM9, MOLPCBA, and LIT-PCBA molecular property prediction benchmarks via transfer learning.

item.title: EfficientViT-SAM: Accelerated Segment Anything Model Without Performance Loss
item.description: For the training, we begin with the knowledge distillation from the SAM-ViT-H image encoder to EfficientViT.

item.title: A Bayesian Approach to Online Learning for Contextual Restless Bandits with Applications to Public Health
item.description: Restless multi-armed bandits (RMABs) are used to model sequential resource allocation in public health intervention programs.

item.title: Data-efficient Large Vision Models through Sequential Autoregression
item.description: Training general-purpose vision models on purely sequential visual data, eschewing linguistic inputs, has heralded a new frontier in visual understanding.

item.title: Dual-Path Coupled Image Deraining Network via Spatial-Frequency Interaction
item.description: Transformers have recently emerged as a significant force in the field of image deraining.
